html.p: Definition. Given a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] with an inner product, we say a list [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2; \ldots v_ n\}[/mathjaxinline] in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is orthogonal if [mathjaxinline]\langle v_ i,v_ j\rangle = 0[/mathjaxinline] for [mathjaxinline]i\ne j[/mathjaxinline]. The list is orthonormal if it is orthogonal, and [mathjaxinline]\| v_ i\| = 1[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]i[/mathjaxinline].
Theorem. Any orthogonal list of non-zero vectors is linearly independent.
